findings.vulnerability_type_claimed: Denial of Service (infinite loop / non-terminating swap)
findings.reasoning: The finding correctly identifies a critical logic error in the provided code. Because _computeSwapStep uses integer division by 2 (LN-194) and returns the current price unchanged (LN-197), the while loop in swap() will never terminate if amountSpecified reaches 1 or -1. This is a genuine, high-severity vulnerability in the provided snippet that would cause all swaps to fail due to Out-of-Gas, though it is not the specific KyberSwap-style arithmetic error described in the ground truth.

notes: The model missed the target vulnerability (the KyberSwap Elastic precision/overflow issue in _addLiquidity) and instead found a different, valid critical bug related to the simplified implementation of the swap loop. The target vulnerability requires identifying that _addLiquidity (LN-152) can be manipulated via tick crossings to cause incorrect liquidity tracking, whereas the model focused on the infinite loop in the swap logic.
